intro: Ricinocarpus leptopodus, commonly known as the slender sea bean, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Leguminosae. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows in coastal areas and saline soils. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, followed by pod-like fruits containing smooth, kidney-shaped seeds. It is adapted to saltwater environments and can tolerate moderate levels of salinity. Its botanical features make it an important species in coastal ecosystems and a subject of study in phytogeography.
